page.title: 03TRANSPORT IN 1985
page.content: Nowadays we have cars to travel in. We also have buses and bikes to ride. People ride on motor bikes as well.For transporting furniture and goods for shops we have lorries. For quite long distances people travel on trains. When people travel from country to country they usually travel on aeroplanes such as Jumbo jets or Concorde. Some other transport is boats and ships and sometimes helicopters.Besides travelling on jets people can get to other countries by travelling on boats but this is usually much slower.If people want to get from one side of quite a big river to the other they can go on a ferry.There are two ferries which take passengers from Truro to Falmouth and there is a smaller one called King Harry Ferry to take people across at Feock.
